title: The Pepsi Gravity Document: Design Overreach
description: A quick, practical guide to The Pepsi Gravity Document: Design Overreach.

hook.text: In 2008, Pepsi paid $1 million for a new logo. The design document referenced the golden ratio and gravity.

buildup.text: The Arnell Group's brief connected the Pepsi globe to magnetic fields, the Mona Lisa, and Feng Shui.

discovery.text: The 27-page document was leaked and became an instant meme in the design world.

twist.text: The actual logo? A slightly tilted version of the old one. The brief was more creative than the design.

climax.text: Pepsi's brief became the cautionary tale of overthinking â€” when design rationale eclipses the design.

punchline.text: If your logo needs 27 pages to explain, it's not the logo that's clever.

quiz.question: What was notable about the Pepsi redesign document?
options: It made absurd connections to gravity and Feng Shui
It was written by Pepsi's CEO
